sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Welcome to Unit 118 of our English learning journey. In this unit, we'll explore the usage of 'like' and 'as if' to express similarity or comparison.

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: Understanding the nuances between these expressions will enhance your ability to convey thoughts and comparisons accurately. Let's delve into the key concepts

sections.title: 'Like' for Comparison
sections.content: Define the usage of 'in case' to indicate a precautionary measure or preparation for a possible future event
points: Define the use of 'like' to express similarity or resemblance

sections.title: 'As If' for Unreal Situations
sections.content: Discuss the use of 'as if' to express hypothetical or unreal situations..
points: He acted as if he owned the place
She talks as if she knows everything

sections.title: Examples
sections.content: Let's examine examples to illustrate the application of 'like' and 'as if'
points: He looked at me as if he had seen a ghost.
The dress fits like a glove

sections.title: Usage and Content
sections.content: Understand the appropriate contexts for using 'like' and 'as if' and how they contribute to the overall meaning of a sentence.

sections.title: Recap and Summary:
sections.content: In summary, mastering the use of 'like' and 'as if' allows you to express similarity and hypothetical situations with precision.

sections.title: Additional Resources:
sections.content: For additional practice and reinforcement, consider exploring examples in language learning books and online exercises.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.content: Thank you for joining today's lesson on 'Like, As If.' Practice using these expressions confidently in various situations, and feel free to reach out if you have any questions. Happy learning!
